instructions: ["tablespoon of butter and", "tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Season both sides of each chicken breast with seasoned salt and a pinch of pepper. Season the boiling water with a few generous pinches of kosher salt. Add the pasta and give it a stir. Cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente, about", "minutes. Reserve 1/", "cup of  pasta water before draining the pasta.  Remove the chicken from the pan and transfer it to a cutting board; allow it to rest. Turn the heat down to medium and dd the remaining", "tablespoon of butter and olive oil to the same pan you used to cook the chicken. Add the veggies (minus the garlic) and red pepper flakes to the pan and stir to coat with the oil and butter (refrain from seasoning with salt until the veggies are finished browning). Cook, stirring often, until the veggies are tender, about", "minutes. Add the garlic and a generous pinch of salt and pepper to the pan and cook for", "minute.  Deglaze the pan with the white wine. Continue to cook until the wine has reduced by half, about", "minutes. Stir in the milk, heavy cream, and reserved pasta water. Bring the mixture to a gentle boil and allow to simmer and reduce for", "minutes. Turn off the heat and add the Parmesan cheese and cooked pasta. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with Parmesan cheese and chopped parsley, if desired."]

title: Fettuccine Alfredo

title: Fettucine alfredo
ingredients: [{"name": "Clotted Cream", "measure": "227g", "original": "227g Clotted Cream"}, {"name": "Butter", "measure": "25g", "original": "25g Butter"}, {"name": "Corn Flour", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Corn Flour"}, {"name": "Parmesan Cheese", "measure": "100g", "original": "100g Parmesan Cheese"}, {"name": "Nutmeg", "measure": "Grated", "original": "Grated Nutmeg"}, {"name": "Fettuccine", "measure": "250g", "original": "250g Fettuccine"}, {"name": "Parsley", "measure": "Chopped", "original": "Chopped Parsley"}]
instructions:
["In a medium saucepan, stir the clotted cream, butter and cornflour over a low-ish heat and bring to a low simmer. Turn off the heat and keep warm.
Meanwhile, put the cheese and nutmeg in a small bowl and add a good grinding of black pepper, then stir everything together (don’t add any salt at this stage).
Put the pasta in another pan with", "tsp salt, pour over some boiling water and cook following pack instructions (usually", "mins). When cooked, scoop some of the cooking water into a heatproof jug or mug and drain the pasta, but not too thoroughly.
Add the pasta to the pan with the clotted cream mixture, then sprinkle over the cheese and gently fold everything together over a low heat using a rubber spatula. When combined, splash in", "tbsp of the cooking water. At first, the pasta will look wet and sloppy: keep stirring until the water is absorbed and the sauce is glossy. Check the seasoning before transferring to heated bowls. Sprinkle over some chives or parsley, then serve immediately."]

title: Lasagne
ingredients: [{"name": "Olive Oil", "measure": "1 tblsp", "original": "1 tblsp Olive Oil"}, {"name": "Bacon", "measure": "2", "original": "2 Bacon"}, {"name": "Onion", "measure": "1 finely chopped", "original": "1 finely chopped Onion"}, {"name": "Celery", "measure": "1 Stick", "original": "1 Stick Celery"}, {"name": "Carrots", "measure": "1 medium", "original": "1 medium Carrots"}, {"name": "Garlic", "measure": "2 cloves chopped", "original": "2 cloves chopped Garlic"}, {"name": "Minced Beef", "measure": "500g", "original": "500g Minced Beef"}, {"name": "Tomato Puree", "measure": "1 tbls", "original": "1 tbls Tomato Puree"}, {"name": "Chopped Tomatoes", "measure": "800g", "original": "800g Chopped Tomatoes"}, {"name": "Honey", "measure": "1 tblsp", "original": "1 tblsp Honey"}, {"name": "Lasagne Sheets", "measure": "500g", "original": "500g Lasagne Sheets"}, {"name": "Creme Fraiche", "measure": "400ml", "original": "400ml Creme Fraiche"}, {"name": "Mozzarella Balls", "measure": "125g", "original": "125g Mozzarella Balls"}, {"name": "Parmesan Cheese", "measure": "50g", "original": "50g Parmesan Cheese"}, {"name": "Basil Leaves", "measure": "Topping", "original": "Topping Basil Leaves"}]
instructions:
["Heat the oil in a large saucepan. Use kitchen scissors to snip the bacon into small pieces, or use a sharp knife to chop it on a chopping board. Add the bacon to the pan and cook for just a few mins until starting to turn golden. Add the onion, celery and carrot, and cook over a medium heat for", "mins, stirring occasionally, until softened.
Add the garlic and cook for", "min, then tip in the mince and cook, stirring and breaking it up with a wooden spoon, for about", "mins until browned all over.
Stir in the tomato purée and cook for", "min, mixing in well with the beef and vegetables. Tip in the chopped tomatoes. Fill each can half full with water to rinse out any tomatoes left in the can, and add to the pan. Add the honey and season to taste. Simmer for", "mins.
Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas", "To assemble the lasagne, ladle a little of the ragu sauce into the bottom of the roasting tin or casserole dish, spreading the sauce all over the base. Place", "sheets of lasagne on top of the sauce overlapping to make it fit, then repeat with more sauce and another layer of pasta. Repeat with a further", "layers of sauce and pasta, finishing with a layer of pasta.
Put the crème fraîche in a bowl and mix with", "tbsp water to loosen it and make a smooth pourable sauce. Pour this over the top of the pasta, then top with the mozzarella. Sprinkle Parmesan over the top and bake for 25–", "mins until golden and bubbling. Serve scattered with basil, if you like."]

title: Mediterranean Pasta Salad
ingredients: [{"name": "mozzarella balls", "measure": "200 g", "original": "200 g mozzarella balls"}, {"name": "baby plum tomatoes", "measure": "250 g", "original": "250 g baby plum tomatoes"}, {"name": "fresh basil", "measure": "1  bunch", "original": "1  bunch fresh basil"}, {"name": "farfalle", "measure": "350 g", "original": "350 g farfalle"}, {"name": "extra virgin olive oil", "measure": "3  tablespoons", "original": "3  tablespoons extra virgin olive oil"}, {"name": "Green Olives", "measure": "40 g", "original": "40 g Green Olives"}, {"name": "tuna", "measure": "200 g", "original": "200 g tuna"}, {"name": "salt", "measure": "to taste", "original": "to taste salt"}, {"name": "pepper", "measure": "to taste", "original": "to taste pepper"}]
instructions: ["Bring a large saucepan of salted water to the boil", "Add the pasta, stir once and cook for about 10 minutes or as directed on the packet.", "Meanwhile, wash the tomatoes and cut into quarters. Slice the olives. Wash the basil.", "Put the tomatoes into a salad bowl and tear the basil leaves over them. Add a tablespoon of olive oil and mix.", "When the pasta is ready, drain into a colander and run cold water over it to cool it quickly.", "Toss the pasta into the salad bowl with the tomatoes and basil.", "Add the sliced olives, drained mozzarella balls, and chunks of tuna. Mix well and let the salad rest for at least half an hour to allow the flavours to mingle.", "Sprinkle the pasta with a generous grind of black pepper and drizzle with the remaining olive oil just before serving."]

title: Osso Buco alla Milanese
ingredients: [{"name": "Veal", "measure": "4 meaty shanks", "original": "4 meaty shanks Veal"}, {"name": "Flour", "measure": "\u00bd cup", "original": "\u00bd cup Flour"}, {"name": "Olive Oil", "measure": "2 tablespoons", "original": "2 tablespoons Olive Oil"}, {"name": "Butter", "measure": "3 tablespoons", "original": "3 tablespoons Butter"}, {"name": "Onion", "measure": "1 medium chopped into \u00bd-inch pieces", "original": "1 medium chopped into \u00bd-inch pieces Onion"}, {"name": "Carrots", "measure": "1 chopped into \u00bd-inch pieces", "original": "1 chopped into \u00bd-inch pieces Carrots"}, {"name": "Celery", "measure": "1 chopped into \u00bd-inch pieces", "original": "1 chopped into \u00bd-inch pieces Celery"}, {"name": "Fennel", "measure": "1 bulb chopped into \u00bd-inch pieces", "original": "1 bulb chopped into \u00bd-inch pieces Fennel"}, {"name": "Garlic", "measure": "3 cloves", "original": "3 cloves Garlic"}, {"name": "Orange Zest", "measure": "2 strips", "original": "2 strips Orange Zest"}, {"name": "Marjoram", "measure": "1 \u00bd teaspoons", "original": "1 \u00bd teaspoons Marjoram"}, {"name": "Bay Leaf", "measure": "1", "original": "1 Bay Leaf"}, {"name": "Dry White Wine", "measure": "1 cup", "original": "1 cup Dry White Wine"}, {"name": "Chicken Stock", "measure": "\u00bd cup", "original": "\u00bd cup Chicken Stock"}, {"name": "Tomatoes", "measure": "1 cup chopped with juice", "original": "1 cup chopped with juice Tomatoes"}, {"name": "Parsley", "measure": "2 tablespoons chopped", "original": "2 tablespoons chopped Parsley"}, {"name": "Garlic", "measure": "1 teaspoon minced", "original": "1 teaspoon minced Garlic"}, {"name": "Lemon Zest", "measure": "1 teaspoon grated", "original": "1 teaspoon grated Lemon Zest"}]
instructions:
["Heat the oven to", "degrees.
Dredging the shanks: pour the flour into a shallow dish (a pie plate works nicely). Season the veal shanks on all sides with salt and pepper. One at a time, roll the shanks around in the flour coat, and shake and pat the shank to remove any excuses flour. Discard the remaining flour.
Browning the shanks: put the oil and", "tablespoon of the butter in a wide Dutch oven or heavy braising pot (", "quart) and heat over medium-high heat. When the butter has melted and the oil is shimmering, lower the shanks into the pot, flat side down; if the shanks won’t fit without touching one another, do this in batches. Brown the shanks, turning once with tongs, until both flat sides are well caramelized, about", "minutes per side. If the butter-oil mixture starts to burn, lower the heat just a bit. Transfer the shanks to a large platter or tray and set aside.
The aromatics: pour off and discard the fat from the pot. Wipe out any burnt bits with a damp paper towel, being careful not to remove any delicious little caramelized bits. Ad the remaining", "tablespoons butter to the pot and melt it over medium heat. When the butter has stopped foaming, add the onion, carrot, celery, and fennel. Season with salt and pepper, stir, and cook the vegetables until they begin to soften but do not brown, about", "minutes. Stir in the garlic, orange zest, marjoram, and bay leaf, and stew for another minute or two.
The braising liquid: add the wine, increase the heat to high, and bring to a boil. Boil, stirring occasionally, to reduce the wine by about half,", "minutes. Add the stock and tomatoes, with their juice, and boil again to reduce the liquid to about", "cup total, about", "minutes.
The braise: Place the shanks in the pot so that they are sitting with the exposed bone facing up, and pour over any juices that accumulated as they sat. Cover with parchment paper, pressing down so the parchment nearly touches the veal and the edges hang over the sides of the pot by about an inch. Cover tightly with the lid, and slide into the lower part of the oven to braise at a gentle simmer. Check the pot after the first", "minutes, and if the liquid is simmering too aggressively, lower the oven heat by", "degrees. Continue braising, turning the shanks and spooning some pan juices over the top after the first", "minutes, until the meat is completely tender and pulling away from the bone, about", "hours.
The gremolata: While the shanks are braising, stir together the garlic, parsley, and lemon zest in a small bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and set aside in a cool place (or the refrigerator, if your kitchen is very warm.)
The finish: When the veal is fork-tender and falling away from the bone, remove the lid and sprinkle over half of the gremolata. Return the veal to the oven, uncovered, for another", "minutes to caramelize it some.
Using a slotted spatula or spoon, carefully lift the shanks from the braising liquid, doing your best to keep them intact. The shanks will be very tender and threatening to fall into pieces, and the marrow will be wobbly inside the bones, so this can be a bit tricky. But if they do break apart, don’t worry, the flavor won’t suffer at all. Arrange the shanks on a serving platter or other large plate, without stacking, and cover with foil to keep warm.
Finishing the sauce: Set the braising pot on top of the stove and evaluate the sauce: if there is a visible layer of fat floating on the surface, use a large spoon to skim it off and discard it. Taste the sauce for concentration of flavor. If it tastes a bit weak or flat, bring it to a boil over high heat, and boil to reduce the volume and intensify the flavor for", "minutes. Taste again for salt and pepper. If the sauce wants more zip, stir in a teaspoon or two of the remaining gremolata.
Portioning the veal shanks: if the shanks are reasonably sized, serve one per person. If the shanks are gargantuan or you’re dealing with modest appetites, pull apart the larger shanks, separating them at their natural seams, and serve smaller amounts. Be sure to give the marrow bones to whomever prizes them most.
Serving: Arrange the veal shanks on warm dinner plates accompanied by the risotto, if serving. Just before carrying the plates to the table, sprinkle on the remaining gremolata and then spoon over a generous amount of sauce – the contact with the hot liquid will aromatize the gremolata and perk up everyone’s appetite with the whiff of garlic and lemon."]

title: Pilchard puttanesca

Cook, breaking up the fish with a wooden spoon, then add the olives and continue to cook for a few more mins.\r\n\r\nDrain the pasta and add to the pan with", "tbsp of the cooking water. title: Pizza Express Margherita
ingredients: [{"name": "Water", "measure": "150ml", "original": "150ml Water"}, {"name": "Sugar", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Sugar"}, {"name": "Yeast", "measure": "15g", "original": "15g Yeast"}, {"name": "Plain Flour", "measure": "225g", "original": "225g Plain Flour"}, {"name": "Salt", "measure": "1 1/2 tsp", "original": "1 1/2 tsp Salt"}, {"name": "Olive Oil", "measure": "Drizzle", "original": "Drizzle Olive Oil"}, {"name": "Passata", "measure": "80g", "original": "80g Passata"}, {"name": "Mozzarella", "measure": "70g", "original": "70g Mozzarella"}, {"name": "Oregano", "measure": "Peeled and Sliced", "original": "Peeled and Sliced Oregano"}, {"name": "Basil", "measure": "Leaves", "original": "Leaves Basil"}, {"name": "Black Pepper", "measure": "Pinch", "original": "Pinch Black Pepper"}]
instructions: ["Preheat the oven to 230\u00b0C.", "Add the sugar and crumble the fresh yeast into warm water.", "Allow the mixture to stand for", "minutes in a warm place (we find a windowsill on a sunny day works best) until froth develops on the surface.", "Sift the flour and salt into a large mixing bowl, make a well in the middle and pour in the yeast mixture and olive oil.", "Lightly flour your hands, and slowly mix the ingredients together until they bind.", "Generously dust your surface with flour.", "Throw down the dough and begin kneading for", "minutes until smooth, silky and soft.", "Place in a lightly oiled, non-stick baking tray (we use a round one, but any shape will do!)", "Spread the passata on top making sure you go to the edge.", "Evenly place the mozzarella (or other cheese) on top, season with the oregano and black pepper, then drizzle with a little olive oil.", "Cook in the oven for", "minutes until the cheese slightly colours.", "When ready, place the basil leaf on top and tuck in!"]

title: Potato Gratin with Chicken
ingredients: [{"name": "Potatoes", "measure": "800g", "original": "800g Potatoes"}, {"name": "Onions", "measure": "3", "original": "3 Onions"}, {"name": "Olive Oil", "measure": "2 tblsp", "original": "2 tblsp Olive Oil"}, {"name": "Chicken Stock", "measure": "100ml", "original": "100ml Chicken Stock"}, {"name": "Creme Fraiche", "measure": "1 pot", "original": "1 pot Creme Fraiche"}, {"name": "Parmesan", "measure": "Topping", "original": "Topping Parmesan"}, {"name": "Chicken Breasts", "measure": "4", "original": "4 Chicken Breasts"}, {"name": "Bacon", "measure": "4", "original": "4 Bacon"}, {"name": "Spinach", "measure": "Topping", "original": "Topping Spinach"}, {"name": "Peas", "measure": "Topping", "original": "Topping Peas"}]
instructions: ["minute potato gratin with chicken and bacon greens: a gratin always seems more effort and more indulgent than ordinary boiled or roasts, but it doesn't have to take 45mins, it's nice for a change and you can control the calorie content by going with full fat to low fat creme fraiche. (It's always tastes better full fat though obviously!) to serve 4: use 800g of potatoes, finely slice and boil in a pan for about", "mins till firmish, not soft. Finely slice", "onions and place in an oven dish with", "tblsp of olive oil and 100ml of chicken stock. Cook till the onions are soft then drain the potatoes and pour onto the onions. Season and spoon over cream or creme fraiche till all is covered but not swimming. Grate Parmesan over the top then finish under the grill till nicely golden. serve with chicken and bacon, peas and spinach."]

title: Ribollita
ingredients: [{"name": "Olive Oil", "measure": "5 tablespoons", "original": "5 tablespoons Olive Oil"}, {"name": "Onion", "measure": "1 chopped", "original": "1 chopped Onion"}, {"name": "Carrots", "measure": "1 chopped", "original": "1 chopped Carrots"}, {"name": "Celery", "measure": "1 stalk chopped", "original": "1 stalk chopped Celery"}, {"name": "Garlic", "measure": "1 tablespoon minced", "original": "1 tablespoon minced Garlic"}, {"name": "Cannellini Beans", "measure": "2 cups", "original": "2 cups Cannellini Beans"}, {"name": "Canned tomatoes", "measure": "1", "original": "1 Canned tomatoes"}, {"name": "Water", "measure": "4 cups", "original": "4 cups Water"}, {"name": "Rosemary", "measure": "1 fresh sprig", "original": "1 fresh sprig Rosemary"}, {"name": "Thyme", "measure": "1 fresh sprig", "original": "1 fresh sprig Thyme"}, {"name": "Kale", "measure": "1 pound chopped", "original": "1 pound chopped Kale"}, {"name": "Wholegrain Bread", "measure": "4 thick slices", "original": "4 thick slices Wholegrain Bread"}, {"name": "Red Onions", "measure": "1 thinly sliced", "original": "1 thinly sliced Red Onions"}, {"name": "Parmesan", "measure": "\u00bd cup freshly grated", "original": "\u00bd cup freshly grated Parmesan"}]
instructions:
["tablespoons of the oil in a large pot over medium heat. When it’s hot, add onion, carrot, celery and garlic; sprinkle with salt and pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are soft,", "minutes.
Heat the oven to", "degrees. Drain the beans; if they’re canned, rinse them as well. Add them to the pot along with tomatoes and their juices and stock, rosemary and thyme. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat so the soup bubbles steadily; cover and cook, stirring once or twice to break up the tomatoes, until the flavors meld,", "minutes.
Fish out and discard rosemary and thyme stems, if you like, and stir in kale. Taste and adjust seasoning. Lay bread slices on top of the stew so they cover the top and overlap as little as possible. Scatter red onion slices over the top, drizzle with the remaining", "tablespoons oil and sprinkle with Parmesan.
Put the pot in the oven and bake until the bread, onions and cheese are browned and crisp,", "minutes. (If your pot fits under the broiler, you can also brown the top there.) Divide the soup and bread among", "bowls and serve."]

title: Rigatoni with fennel sausage sauce
ingredients: [{"name": "olive oil", "measure": "2\u00bd tbsp", "original": "2\u00bd tbsp olive oil"}, {"name": "Italian fennel sausages", "measure": "6 cut into 1.5cm-thick slices", "original": "6 cut into 1.5cm-thick slices Italian fennel sausages"}, {"name": "onion", "measure": "1 large peeled and chopped", "original": "1 large peeled and chopped onion"}, {"name": "fennel bulb", "measure": "1 trimmed and roughly chopped; reserve any fronds to garnish", "original": "1 trimmed and roughly chopped; reserve any fronds to garnish fennel bulb"}, {"name": "smoky paprika", "measure": "\u00bd tsp", "original": "\u00bd tsp smoky paprika"}, {"name": "garlic", "measure": "1 clove, peeled and sliced", "original": "1 clove, peeled and sliced garlic"}, {"name": "fennel seeds", "measure": "2 tsp lightly toasted and then gently crushed", "original": "2 tsp lightly toasted and then gently crushed fennel seeds"}, {"name": "red wine", "measure": "100ml", "original": "100ml red wine"}, {"name": "chopped tomatoes", "measure": "400g tinned", "original": "400g tinned chopped tomatoes"}, {"name": "caster sugar", "measure": "\u00bd tsp", "original": "\u00bd tsp caster sugar"}, {"name": "pitted black olives", "measure": "50g cut in half lengthways", "original": "50g cut in half lengthways pitted black olives"}, {"name": "rigatoni", "measure": "500g", "original": "500g rigatoni"}, {"name": "pecorino", "measure": "30g roughly crumbled into 0.5cm pieces", "original": "30g roughly crumbled into 0.5cm pieces pecorino"}, {"name": "anchovy fillet", "measure": "1  rinsed and patted dry", "original": "1  rinsed and patted dry anchovy fillet"}, {"name": "garlic", "measure": "1 clove, peeled and crushed", "original": "1 clove, peeled and crushed garlic"}, {"name": "olive oil", "measure": "60ml", "original": "60ml olive oil"}, {"name": "basil leaves", "measure": "50g torn", "original": "50g torn basil leaves"}]
instructions:
["Heat a tablespoon of oil in a large saute pan for which you have a lid. Add the sausage pieces and fry on a medium-high heat for", "minutes, stirring regularly, until golden-brown all over. Transfer the sausages to a plate, then add the onion and fennel to the hot pan and fry for", "minutes, stirring once in a while, until soft and caramelised; if the pan goes a bit dry, add a teaspoon or so of extra oil. Stir in the paprika, garlic and half the fennel seeds, fry for two minutes more, then pour on the wine and boil for", "seconds, to reduce by half. Add the tomatoes, sugar, 100ml water, the seared sausage and half a teaspoon of salt, cover and simmer for", "minutes; remove the lid after", "minutes, and cook until the sauce is thick and rich. Remove from the heat, stir through the olives and remaining fennel seeds and set aside until you’re ready to serve.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil, add the pasta and cook for", "minutes (or according to the instructions on the packet), until al dente. Meanwhile, reheat the sauce. Drain the pasta, return it to the pot, stir in a tablespoon of oil, then divide between the bowls. 

Put all the pesto ingredients except the basil in the small bowl of a food processor. Add a tablespoon of water and blitz to a rough paste. Add the basil, then blitz until just combined (the pesto has a much better texture if the basil is not overblended).

Spoon over the ragù and top with a spoonful of pesto. Finish with a sprinkling of chopped fennel fronds, if you have any, and serve at once."]

title: Salmon Prawn Risotto

instructions: ["Melt the butter in a thick-based pan and gently cook the onion without colour until it is soft.", "Add the rice and stir to coat all the grains in the butter", "Add the wine and cook gently stirring until it is absorbed", "Gradually add the hot stock, stirring until each addition is absorbed. Keep stirring until the rice is tender", "Season with the lemon juice and zest, and pepper to taste. (there will probably be sufficient saltiness from the salmon to not need to add salt) Stir gently to heat through", "Serve scattered with the Parmesan and seasonal vegetables.", "Grill the salmon and gently place onto the risotto with the prawns and asparagus"]

title: Spaghetti alla Carbonara
ingredients: [{"name": "Spaghetti", "measure": "320g", "original": "320g Spaghetti"}, {"name": "Egg Yolks", "measure": "6", "original": "6 Egg Yolks"}, {"name": "Salt", "measure": "As required", "original": "As required Salt"}, {"name": "Bacon", "measure": "150g", "original": "150g Bacon"}, {"name": "Pecorino", "measure": "50g", "original": "50g Pecorino"}, {"name": "Black Pepper", "measure": "As required", "original": "As required Black Pepper"}]
instructions: ["STEP 1", "Put a large saucepan of water on to boil.", "STEP 2", "Finely chop the 100g pancetta, having first removed any rind. Finely grate 50g pecorino cheese and 50g parmesan and mix them together.", "STEP 3", "Beat the 3 large eggs in a medium bowl and season with a little freshly grated black pepper. Set everything aside.", "STEP 4", "Add 1 tsp salt to the boiling water, add 350g spaghetti and when the water comes back to the boil, cook at a constant simmer, covered, for 10 minutes or until al dente (just cooked).", "STEP 5", "Squash 2 peeled plump garlic cloves with the blade of a knife, just to bruise it.", "STEP 6", "While the spaghetti is cooking, fry the pancetta with the garlic. Drop 50g unsalted butter into a large frying pan or wok and, as soon as the butter has melted, tip in the pancetta and garlic.", "STEP 7", "Leave to cook on a medium heat for about 5 minutes, stirring often, until the pancetta is golden and crisp. The garlic has now imparted its flavour, so take it out with a slotted spoon and discard.", "STEP 8", "Keep the heat under the pancetta on low. When the pasta is ready, lift it from the water with a pasta fork or tongs and put it in the frying pan with the pancetta. Don\u2019t worry if a little water drops in the pan as well (you want this to happen) and don\u2019t throw the pasta water away yet.", "STEP 9", "Mix most of the cheese in with the eggs, keeping a small handful back for sprinkling over later.", "STEP 10", "Take the pan of spaghetti and pancetta off the heat. Now quickly pour in the eggs and cheese. Using the tongs or a long fork, lift up the spaghetti so it mixes easily with the egg mixture, which thickens but doesn\u2019t scramble, and everything is coated.", "STEP 11", "Add extra pasta cooking water to keep it saucy (several tablespoons should do it). You don\u2019t want it wet, just moist. Season with a little salt, if needed.", "STEP 12", "Use a long-pronged fork to twist the pasta on to the serving plate or bowl. Serve immediately with a little sprinkling of the remaining cheese and a grating of black pepper. If the dish does get a little dry before serving, splash in some more hot pasta water and the glossy sauciness will be revived."]

title: Spaghetti Bolognese

["Put the onion and oil in a large pan and fry over a fairly high heat for", "mins. Add the garlic and mince and fry until they both brown. Add the mushrooms and herbs, and cook for another couple of mins.

Stir in the tomatoes, beef stock, tomato ketchup or purée, Worcestershire sauce and seasoning. Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat, cover and simmer, stirring occasionally, for", "mins.

Meanwhile, cook the spaghetti in a large pan of boiling, salted water, according to packet instructions. Drain well, run hot water through it, put it back in the pan and add a dash of olive oil, if you like, then stir in the meat sauce. title: Spicy Arrabiata Penne
ingredients: [{"name": "penne rigate", "measure": "1 pound", "original": "1 pound penne rigate"}, {"name": "olive oil", "measure": "1/4 cup", "original": "1/4 cup olive oil"}, {"name": "garlic", "measure": "3 cloves", "original": "3 cloves garlic"}, {"name": "chopped tomatoes", "measure": "1 tin", "original": "1 tin chopped tomatoes"}, {"name": "red chilli flakes", "measure": "1/2 teaspoon", "original": "1/2 teaspoon red chilli flakes"}, {"name": "italian seasoning", "measure": "1/2 teaspoon", "original": "1/2 teaspoon italian seasoning"}, {"name": "basil", "measure": "6 leaves", "original": "6 leaves basil"}, {"name": "Parmigiano-Reggiano", "measure": "sprinkling", "original": "sprinkling Parmigiano-Reggiano"}]

title: Spinach & Ricotta Cannelloni
ingredients: [{"name": "Olive Oil", "measure": "3 tbsp", "original": "3 tbsp Olive Oil"}, {"name": "Garlic", "measure": "8 cloves chopped", "original": "8 cloves chopped Garlic"}, {"name": "Caster Sugar", "measure": "3 tbsp", "original": "3 tbsp Caster Sugar"}, {"name": "Red Wine Vinegar", "measure": "2 tblsp", "original": "2 tblsp Red Wine Vinegar"}, {"name": "Chopped Tomatoes", "measure": "3 400g Cans", "original": "3 400g Cans Chopped Tomatoes"}, {"name": "Basil Leaves", "measure": "Bunch", "original": "Bunch Basil Leaves"}, {"name": "Mascarpone", "measure": "2 tubs", "original": "2 tubs Mascarpone"}, {"name": "Milk", "measure": "3 tbsp", "original": "3 tbsp Milk"}, {"name": "Parmesan", "measure": "85g", "original": "85g Parmesan"}, {"name": "Mozzarella", "measure": "2 sliced", "original": "2 sliced Mozzarella"}, {"name": "Spinach", "measure": "1kg", "original": "1kg Spinach"}, {"name": "Parmesan", "measure": "100g", "original": "100g Parmesan"}, {"name": "Ricotta", "measure": "3 tubs", "original": "3 tubs Ricotta"}, {"name": "Nutmeg", "measure": "pinch", "original": "pinch Nutmeg"}, {"name": "Cannellini Beans", "measure": "400g", "original": "400g Cannellini Beans"}]
instructions:
["First make the tomato sauce. Heat the oil in a large pan and fry the garlic for", "min. Add the sugar, vinegar, tomatoes and some seasoning and simmer for", "mins, stirring occasionally, until thick. Add the basil and divide the sauce between", "or more shallow ovenproof dishes (see Tips for freezing, below). Set aside. Make a sauce by beating the mascarpone with the milk until smooth, season, then set aside.

Put the spinach in a large colander and pour over a kettle of boiling water to wilt it (you may need to do this in batches). When cool enough to handle squeeze out the excess water. Roughly chop the spinach and mix in a large bowl with 100g Parmesan and ricotta. Season well with salt, pepper and the nutmeg.

Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas", "Using a piping bag or plastic food bag with the corner snipped off, squeeze the filling into the cannelloni tubes. Lay the tubes, side by side, on top of the tomato sauce and spoon over the mascarpone sauce. Top with Parmesan and mozzarella. title: Venetian Duck Ragu

instructions: ["Heat the oil in a large pan. Add the duck legs and brown on all sides for about", "mins. Remove to a plate and set aside. Add the onions to the pan and cook for", "mins until softened. Add the garlic and cook for a further", "min, then stir in the cinnamon and flour and cook for a further min. Return the duck to the pan, add the wine, tomatoes, stock, herbs, sugar and seasoning. Bring to a simmer, then lower the heat, cover with a lid and cook for", "hrs, stirring every now and then.\r\nCarefully lift the duck legs out of the sauce and place on a plate \u2013 they will be very tender so try not to lose any of the meat. Pull off and discard the fat, then shred the meat with", "forks and discard the bones. Add the meat back to the sauce with the milk and simmer, uncovered, for a further", "mins while you cook the pasta.\r\nCook the pasta following pack instructions, then drain, reserving a cup of the pasta water, and add the pasta to the ragu. Stir to coat all the pasta in the sauce and cook for", "min more, adding a splash of cooking liquid if it looks dry. Serve with grated Parmesan, if you like."]

title: Braised Beef Chilli

title: Cajun spiced fish tacos

title: Chicken Enchilada Casserole
ingredients: [{"name": "Enchilada sauce", "measure": "14 oz jar", "original": "14 oz jar Enchilada sauce"}, {"name": "shredded Monterey Jack cheese", "measure": "3 Cups", "original": "3 Cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese"}, {"name": "corn tortillas", "measure": "6", "original": "6 corn tortillas"}, {"name": "chicken breasts", "measure": "2", "original": "2 chicken breasts"}]
instructions:
["Cut each chicken breast in about", "pieces, so that it cooks faster and put it in a small pot. Pour Enchilada sauce over it and cook covered on low to medium heat until chicken is cooked through, about", "minutes. No water is needed, the chicken will cook in the Enchilada sauce. Make sure you stir occasionally so that it doesn't stick to the bottom.
Remove chicken from the pot and shred with two forks.
Preheat oven to", "F degrees.
Start layering the casserole. Start with about ¼ cup of the leftover Enchilada sauce over the bottom of a baking dish. I used a longer baking dish, so that I can put", "corn tortillas across. Place", "tortillas on the bottom, top with ⅓ of the chicken and ⅓ of the remaining sauce. Sprinkle with ⅓ of the cheese and repeat starting with", "more tortillas, then chicken, sauce, cheese. Repeat with last layer with the remaining ingredients, tortillas, chicken, sauce and cheese.
Bake for", "minutes uncovered, until bubbly and cheese has melted and started to brown on top.
Serve warm."]

title: Chickpea Fajitas
ingredients: [{"name": "Chickpeas", "measure": "400g", "original": "400g Chickpeas"}, {"name": "Olive Oil", "measure": "1 tblsp", "original": "1 tblsp Olive Oil"}, {"name": "Paprika", "measure": "pinch", "original": "pinch Paprika"}, {"name": "Tomatoes", "measure": "2 small cut chunks", "original": "2 small cut chunks Tomatoes"}, {"name": "Red Onions", "measure": "1 finely sliced", "original": "1 finely sliced Red Onions"}, {"name": "Red Wine Vinegar", "measure": "2 tsp", "original": "2 tsp Red Wine Vinegar"}, {"name": "Avocado", "measure": "1", "original": "1 Avocado"}, {"name": "Lime", "measure": "Juice of 1", "original": "Juice of 1 Lime"}, {"name": "Lime", "measure": "Chopped", "original": "Chopped Lime"}, {"name": "Sour Cream", "measure": "100g", "original": "100g Sour Cream"}, {"name": "Harissa Spice", "measure": "2 tsp", "original": "2 tsp Harissa Spice"}, {"name": "Corn Tortillas", "measure": "4", "original": "4 Corn Tortillas"}, {"name": "Coriander", "measure": "to serve", "original": "to serve Coriander"}]
instructions: ["Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6 and line a baking tray with foil. Drain the chickpeas, pat dry and tip onto the prepared baking tray. Add the oil and paprika, toss to coat, then roast for 20-25 mins until browned and crisp, shaking halfway through cooking", "Meanwhile, put the tomatoes and onion in a small bowl with the vinegar and set aside to pickle. Put the avocado in another bowl and mash with a fork, leaving some larger chunks. Stir in the lime juice and season well. Mix the soured cream with the harissa and set aside until ready to serve", "Heat a griddle pan until nearly smoking. Add the tortillas , one at a time, charring each side until hot with griddle lines", "Put everything on the table and build the fajitas : spread a little of the harissa cream over the tortilla, top with roasted chickpeas, guacamole, pickled salsa and coriander, if you like. Serve with the lime wedges for squeezing over."]

title: Crock Pot Chicken Baked Tacos
ingredients: [{"name": "Chicken Breasts", "measure": "4 - 6", "original": "4 - 6 Chicken Breasts"}, {"name": "Vinaigrette Dressing", "measure": "1 bottle", "original": "1 bottle Vinaigrette Dressing"}, {"name": "Cumin", "measure": "1\u00bd tablespoon", "original": "1\u00bd tablespoon Cumin"}, {"name": "Smoked Paprika", "measure": "1 tablespoon", "original": "1 tablespoon Smoked Paprika"}, {"name": "Garlic", "measure": "1 teaspoon", "original": "1 teaspoon Garlic"}, {"name": "Refried Beans", "measure": "1 can", "original": "1 can Refried Beans"}, {"name": "Hard Taco Shells", "measure": "12", "original": "12 Hard Taco Shells"}, {"name": "Shredded Mexican Cheese", "measure": "2 cups", "original": "2 cups Shredded Mexican Cheese"}, {"name": "Grape Tomatoes", "measure": "Halved", "original": "Halved Grape Tomatoes"}, {"name": "Jalapeno", "measure": "Sliced and Seeded", "original": "Sliced and Seeded Jalapeno"}, {"name": "Avocado", "measure": "Peeled and Sliced", "original": "Peeled and Sliced Avocado"}, {"name": "Green Salsa", "measure": "2 tablespoons", "original": "2 tablespoons Green Salsa"}, {"name": "Sour Cream", "measure": "3 tablespoons", "original": "3 tablespoons Sour Cream"}, {"name": "Milk", "measure": "1 tablespoon", "original": "1 tablespoon Milk"}]
instructions: ["Put the uncooked chicken breasts in the crock pot. Pour the full bottle of salad dressing over the chicken. Sprinkle the rest of the ingredients over the top and mix them in a bit with a spoon.", "Cover your crock pot with the lid and cook on high for 4 hours.", "Remove all the chicken breasts from the crock pot and let cool.", "Shred the chicken breasts and move to a glass bowl.", "Pour most of the liquid over the shredded chicken.", "FOR THE TACOS:", "Make the guacamole sauce by mixing the avocado and green salsa together. Pour the guacamole mixture through a strainer until smooth and transfer to a squeeze bottle. Cut the tip off the lid of the squeeze bottle to make the opening more wide if needed.", "Make the sour cream sauce by mixing the sour cream and milk together until you get a more liquid sour cream sauce. Transfer to a squeeze bottle.", "In a 9x 13 glass baking dish, fill all 12+ tacos with a layer of refried beans, cooked chicken and shredded cheese.", "Bake at 450 for 10-15 minutes just until the cheese is melted and bubbling.", "Out of the oven top all the tacos with the sliced grape tomaotes, jalapeno and cilantro.", "Finish with a drizzle of guacamole and sour cream.", "Enjoy!"]

title: Stuffed Bell Peppers with Quinoa and Black Beans
ingredients: [{"name": "Green Pepper", "measure": "4 whole", "original": "4 whole Green Pepper"}, {"name": "Olive Oil", "measure": "1 tablespoon", "original": "1 tablespoon Olive Oil"}, {"name": "Onion", "measure": "1 small finely diced", "original": "1 small finely diced Onion"}, {"name": "Garlic", "measure": "2 cloves minced", "original": "2 cloves minced Garlic"}, {"name": "Quinoa", "measure": "1 cups", "original": "1 cups Quinoa"}, {"name": "Black Beans", "measure": "1 can", "original": "1 can Black Beans"}, {"name": "Sweetcorn", "measure": "1 cup", "original": "1 cup Sweetcorn"}, {"name": "Diced Tomatoes", "measure": "1 can", "original": "1 can Diced Tomatoes"}, {"name": "Cumin", "measure": "1 teaspoon", "original": "1 teaspoon Cumin"}, {"name": "Chili Powder", "measure": "\u00bd tsp", "original": "\u00bd tsp Chili Powder"}, {"name": "Smoked Paprika", "measure": "\u00bd tsp", "original": "\u00bd tsp Smoked Paprika"}, {"name": "Salt", "measure": "To taste", "original": "To taste Salt"}, {"name": "Pepper", "measure": "To taste", "original": "To taste Pepper"}, {"name": "Shredded Mexican Cheese", "measure": "1 1/2 cup", "original": "1 1/2 cup Shredded Mexican Cheese"}, {"name": "Cilantro", "measure": "Chopped", "original": "Chopped Cilantro"}]
instructions: ["Preheat your oven to 375\u00b0F (190\u00b0C). Lightly grease a 9x", "inch baking dish or a similar-sized casserole dish.", "Place the bell pepper halves in the prepared baking dish, cut side up. Bake for", "minutes, or until slightly softened.", "While the bell peppers are baking, prepare the filling. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion, and cook for", "minutes, until softened. Add the garlic, and cook for another", "minute, until fragrant.", "Stir in the cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, diced tomatoes, ground cumin, chili powder, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper. Cook for", "minutes, until heated through. Remove the skillet from heat, and stir in", "cup of the shredded cheese, if using.", "Remove the bell peppers from the oven, and carefully stuff each pepper half with the quinoa and black bean mixture. Top the stuffed peppers with the remaining 1/", "cup of shredded cheese, if using.", "Return the stuffed peppers to the oven, and bake for another", "minutes, until the cheese is melted and the peppers are tender.", "Remove from the oven, and allow the stuffed peppers to cool for", "minutes before serving. Garnish with fresh chopped cilantro."]

title: Baingan Bharta
ingredients: [{"name": "Aubergine", "measure": "1 large", "original": "1 large Aubergine"}, {"name": "Onion", "measure": "\u00bd cup", "original": "\u00bd cup Onion"}, {"name": "Tomatoes", "measure": "1 cup", "original": "1 cup Tomatoes"}, {"name": "Garlic", "measure": "6 cloves", "original": "6 cloves Garlic"}, {"name": "Green Chilli", "measure": "1", "original": "1 Green Chilli"}, {"name": "Red Chilli Powder", "measure": "\u00bc teaspoon", "original": "\u00bc teaspoon Red Chilli Powder"}, {"name": "Oil", "measure": "1.5 tablespoon", "original": "1.5 tablespoon Oil"}, {"name": "Coriander Leaves", "measure": "1 tablespoon chopped", "original": "1 tablespoon chopped Coriander Leaves"}, {"name": "salt", "measure": "as required", "original": "as required salt"}]
instructions: ["Rinse the baingan (eggplant or aubergine) in water. Pat dry with a kitchen napkin. Apply some oil all over and", "keep it for roasting on an open flame. You can also grill the baingan or roast in the oven. But then you won't get", "the smoky flavor of the baingan. Keep the eggplant turning after a 2 to 3 minutes on the flame, so that its evenly", "cooked. You could also embed some garlic cloves in the baingan and then roast it.", "Roast the aubergine till its completely cooked and tender. With a knife check the doneness. The knife should slid", "easily in aubergines without any resistance. Remove the baingan and immerse in a bowl of water till it cools", "You can also do the dhungar technique of infusing charcoal smoky flavor in the baingan. This is an optional step.", "Use natural charcoal for this method. Heat a small piece of charcoal on flame till it becomes smoking hot and red.", "Make small cuts on the baingan with a knife. Place the red hot charcoal in the same plate where the roasted", "aubergine is kept. Add a few drops of oil on the charcoal. The charcoal would begin to smoke.", "As soon as smoke begins to release from the charcoal, cover the entire plate tightly with a large bowl. Allow the", "charcoal smoke to get infused for 1 to 2 minutes. The more you do, the more smoky the baingan bharta will", "become. I just keep for a minute. Alternatively, you can also do this dhungar method once the baingan bharta is", "cooked, just like the way we do for Dal Tadka.", "Peel the skin from the roasted and smoked eggplant.", "Chop the cooked eggplant finely or you can even mash it.", "In a kadai or pan, heat oil. Then add finely chopped onions and garlic.", "Saute the onions till translucent. Don't brown them.", "Add chopped green chilies and saute for a minute.", "Add the chopped tomatoes and mix it well.", "Bhuno (saute) the tomatoes till the oil starts separating from the mixture.", "Now add the red chili powder. Stir and mix well.", "Add the chopped cooked baingan.", "Stir and mix the chopped baingan very well with the onion\u00adtomato masala mixture.", "Season with salt. Stir and saute for some more 4 to 5 minutes more.", "Finally stir in the coriander leaves with the baingan bharta or garnish it with them. Serve Baingan Bharta with", "phulkas, rotis or chapatis. It goes well even with bread, toasted or grilled bread and plain rice or jeera rice."]

title: Chicken Handi
ingredients: [{"name": "Chicken", "measure": "1.2 kg", "original": "1.2 kg Chicken"}, {"name": "Onion", "measure": "5 thinly sliced", "original": "5 thinly sliced Onion"}, {"name": "Tomatoes", "measure": "2 finely chopped", "original": "2 finely chopped Tomatoes"}, {"name": "Garlic", "measure": "8 cloves chopped", "original": "8 cloves chopped Garlic"}, {"name": "Ginger paste", "measure": "1 tbsp", "original": "1 tbsp Ginger paste"}, {"name": "Vegetable oil", "measure": "\u00bc cup", "original": "\u00bc cup Vegetable oil"}, {"name": "Cumin seeds", "measure": "2 tsp", "original": "2 tsp Cumin seeds"}, {"name": "Coriander seeds", "measure": "3 tsp", "original": "3 tsp Coriander seeds"}, {"name": "Turmeric powder", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Turmeric powder"}, {"name": "Chilli powder", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Chilli powder"}, {"name": "Green chilli", "measure": "2", "original": "2 Green chilli"}, {"name": "Yogurt", "measure": "1 cup", "original": "1 cup Yogurt"}, {"name": "Cream", "measure": "\u00be cup", "original": "\u00be cup Cream"}, {"name": "fenugreek", "measure": "3 tsp Dried", "original": "3 tsp Dried fenugreek"}, {"name": "Garam masala", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Garam masala"}, {"name": "Salt", "measure": "To taste", "original": "To taste Salt"}]
instructions: ["Take a large pot or wok, big enough to cook all the chicken, and heat the oil in it. Once the oil is hot, add sliced onion and fry them until deep golden brown. Then take them out on a plate and set aside", "To the same pot, add the chopped garlic and saut\u00e9 for a minute. Then add the chopped tomatoes and cook until tomatoes turn soft. This would take about 5 minutes", "Then return the fried onion to the pot and stir. Add ginger paste and saut\u00e9 well", "Now add the cumin seeds, half of the coriander seeds and chopped green chillies. Give them a quick stir", "Next goes in the spices \u2013 turmeric powder and red chilli powder. Saut\u00e9 the spices well for couple of minutes", "Add the chicken pieces to the wok, season it with salt to taste and cook the chicken covered on medium-low heat until the chicken is almost cooked through. This would take about 15 minutes. Slowly saut\u00e9ing the chicken will enhance the flavor, so do not expedite this step by putting it on high heat", "When the oil separates from the spices, add the beaten yogurt keeping the heat on lowest so that the yogurt doesn\u2019t split. Sprinkle the remaining coriander seeds and add half of the dried fenugreek leaves. Mix well", "Finally add the cream and give a final mix to combine everything well", "Sprinkle the remaining kasuri methi and garam masala and serve the chicken handi hot with naan or rotis. Enjoy!"]

title: Dal fry
ingredients: [{"name": "Toor dal", "measure": "1 cup", "original": "1 cup Toor dal"}, {"name": "Water", "measure": "2-1/2 cups", "original": "2-1/2 cups Water"}, {"name": "Salt", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Salt"}, {"name": "Turmeric", "measure": "1/4 tsp", "original": "1/4 tsp Turmeric"}, {"name": "Ghee", "measure": "3 tbs", "original": "3 tbs Ghee"}, {"name": "Chopped tomatoes", "measure": "1 cup", "original": "1 cup Chopped tomatoes"}, {"name": "Cumin seeds", "measure": "1/2 tsp", "original": "1/2 tsp Cumin seeds"}, {"name": "Mustard Seeds", "measure": "1/2 tsp", "original": "1/2 tsp Mustard Seeds"}, {"name": "Bay Leaf", "measure": "2", "original": "2 Bay Leaf"}, {"name": "Green Chilli", "measure": "1 tbs chopped", "original": "1 tbs chopped Green Chilli"}, {"name": "Ginger", "measure": "2 tsp shredded", "original": "2 tsp shredded Ginger"}, {"name": "Cilantro", "measure": "2 tbs", "original": "2 tbs Cilantro"}, {"name": "Red Pepper", "measure": "1/2 tsp", "original": "1/2 tsp Red Pepper"}, {"name": "Salt", "measure": "1/2 tsp", "original": "1/2 tsp Salt"}, {"name": "Sugar", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Sugar"}, {"name": "Garam Masala", "measure": "1/4 tsp", "original": "1/4 tsp Garam Masala"}]
instructions: ["Wash and soak toor dal in approx. 3 cups of water, for at least one hours. Dal will be double in volume after soaking. Drain the water", "Cook dal with 2-1/2 cups water and add salt, turmeric, on medium high heat, until soft in texture (approximately 30 mins) it should be like thick soup", "In a frying pan, heat the ghee. Add cumin seeds, and mustard seeds. After the seeds crack, add bay leaves, green chili, ginger and chili powder. Stir for a few seconds", "Add tomatoes, salt and sugar stir and cook until tomatoes are tender and mushy", "Add cilantro and garam masala cook for about one minute", "Pour the seasoning over dal mix it well and cook for another minute", "Serve with Naan."]

title: Kidney Bean Curry
ingredients: [{"name": "Vegetable Oil", "measure": "1 tbls", "original": "1 tbls Vegetable Oil"}, {"name": "Onion", "measure": "1 finely chopped", "original": "1 finely chopped Onion"}, {"name": "Garlic", "measure": "2 cloves chopped", "original": "2 cloves chopped Garlic"}, {"name": "Ginger", "measure": "1 part", "original": "1 part Ginger"}, {"name": "Coriander", "measure": "1 Packet", "original": "1 Packet Coriander"}, {"name": "Cumin", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Cumin"}, {"name": "Paprika", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Paprika"}, {"name": "Garam Masala", "measure": "2 tsp", "original": "2 tsp Garam Masala"}, {"name": "Chopped Tomatoes", "measure": "400g", "original": "400g Chopped Tomatoes"}, {"name": "Kidney Beans", "measure": "400g", "original": "400g Kidney Beans"}, {"name": "Basmati Rice", "measure": "to serve", "original": "to serve Basmati Rice"}]
instructions:
["Heat the oil in a large frying pan over a low-medium heat. Add the onion and a pinch of salt and cook slowly, stirring occasionally, until softened and just starting to colour. Add the garlic, ginger and coriander stalks and cook for a further", "mins, until fragrant.

Add the spices to the pan and cook for another", "min, by which point everything should smell aromatic. Tip in the chopped tomatoes and kidney beans in their water, then bring to the boil.

Turn down the heat and simmer for", "mins until the curry is nice and thick. Season to taste, then serve with the basmati rice and the coriander leaves."]

title: Lamb Biryani
ingredients: [{"name": "Cashew nuts", "measure": "12", "original": "12 Cashew nuts"}, {"name": "Khus khus", "measure": "\u00bd tbsp", "original": "\u00bd tbsp Khus khus"}, {"name": "Cumin seeds", "measure": "\u00bd tbsp", "original": "\u00bd tbsp Cumin seeds"}, {"name": "Onions", "measure": "3 sliced thinly", "original": "3 sliced thinly Onions"}, {"name": "Ginger garlic paste", "measure": "2 tsp", "original": "2 tsp Ginger garlic paste"}, {"name": "Garlic", "measure": "4 whole", "original": "4 whole Garlic"}, {"name": "Mint", "measure": "Leaves", "original": "Leaves Mint"}, {"name": "Cilantro", "measure": "Leaves", "original": "Leaves Cilantro"}, {"name": "Saffron", "measure": "\u00bd tsp dissolved in \u00bd cup warm milk", "original": "\u00bd tsp dissolved in \u00bd cup warm milk Saffron"}, {"name": "Ghee", "measure": "2 tbsp", "original": "2 tbsp Ghee"}, {"name": "Basmati rice", "measure": "2 Cups", "original": "2 Cups Basmati rice"}, {"name": "Full fat yogurt", "measure": "\u00bd cup", "original": "\u00bd cup Full fat yogurt"}, {"name": "Cumin Seeds", "measure": "1 tbsp", "original": "1 tbsp Cumin Seeds"}, {"name": "Bay leaf", "measure": "\u00bd", "original": "\u00bd Bay leaf"}, {"name": "Cinnamon", "measure": "1 thin piece", "original": "1 thin piece Cinnamon"}, {"name": "Cloves", "measure": "3", "original": "3 Cloves"}, {"name": "Cardamom", "measure": "2", "original": "2 Cardamom"}, {"name": "Lamb", "measure": "1 lb", "original": "1 lb Lamb"}, {"name": "Red Chilli powder", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Red Chilli powder"}, {"name": "Biryani masala", "measure": "1 tbsp", "original": "1 tbsp Biryani masala"}]
instructions: ["Grind the cashew, poppy seeds and cumin seeds into a smooth paste, using as little water as possible. Set aside.", "Deep fry the sliced onions when it is hot. Don\u2019t overcrowd the oil. When the onions turn light brown, remove from oil and drain on paper towel. The fried onion will crisp up as it drains. Also fry the cashewnuts till golden brown. Set aside.", "Wash the rice and soak in water for twenty minutes.", "Meanwhile, take a big wide pan, add oil in medium heat, add the sliced onions, add the blended paste, to it add the green chillies, ginger garlic paste and garlic and fry for a minute.", "Then add the tomatoes and saut\u00e9 them well till they are cooked and not mushy.", "Then to it add the red chilli powder, biryani powder, mint, coriander leaves and saut\u00e9 them well.", "Add the yogurt and mix well. I always move the skillet away from the heat when adding yogurt which prevents it from curdling.", "Now after returning the skillet back to the stove, add the washed lamb and salt and \u00bd cup water and mix well. Cook for 1 hour and cook it covered in medium low heat or put it in a pressure cooker for 6 whistles. If the water is not drained totally, heat it by keeping it open.", "Take another big pan, add thrice the cup of rice you use, and boil it. When it is boiling high, add the rice, salt and jeera and mix well. After 7 minutes exact or when the rice is 80% done. Switch off and drain the rice.", "Now, the layering starts. To the lamb, pat and level it. Add the drained hot rice on the top of it. Garnish with fried onions, ghee, mint, coriander leaves and saffron dissolved in milk.", "Cover the dish and bake in a 350f oven for 15 minutes or till the cooked but not mushy. Or cook in the stove medium heat for 12 minutes and lowest heat for 5 minutes. And switch off. Mix and serve hot!", "If you are cooking in oven, do make sure to cook in a big oven safe pan and cover it tight and then keep in oven for the final step.", "You can skip biryani masala if you don\u2019t have and add just garam masala (1 tsp and red chilli powder \u2013 3 tsp instead of 1 tsp)", "If it is spicy in the end, squeeze some lemon, it will reduce the heat and enhance the flavors also."]

title: Lamb Rogan josh

instructions: ["Put the onions in a food processor and whizz until very finely chopped. Heat the oil in a large heavy-based pan, then fry the onion with the lid on, stirring every now and then, until it is really golden and soft. Add the garlic and ginger, then fry for", "mins more.\r\nTip the curry paste, all the spices and the bay leaves into the pan, with the tomato pur\u00e9e. Stir well over the heat for about", "secs, then add the meat and 300ml water. Stir to mix, turn down the heat, then add the yogurt.\r\nCover the pan, then gently simmer for", "mins until the meat is tender and the sauce nice and thick. Serve scattered with coriander, with plain basmati or pilau rice."]

title: Matar Paneer
ingredients: [{"name": "Sunflower Oil", "measure": "1 tbls", "original": "1 tbls Sunflower Oil"}, {"name": "Paneer", "measure": "225g", "original": "225g Paneer"}, {"name": "Ginger", "measure": "2", "original": "2 Ginger"}, {"name": "Cumin", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Cumin"}, {"name": "Turmeric", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Turmeric"}, {"name": "Coriander", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Coriander"}, {"name": "Green Chilli", "measure": "1", "original": "1 Green Chilli"}, {"name": "Tomato", "measure": "4 large", "original": "4 large Tomato"}, {"name": "Peas", "measure": "150g", "original": "150g Peas"}, {"name": "Garam Masala", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Garam Masala"}, {"name": "Coriander", "measure": "Small bunch", "original": "Small bunch Coriander"}, {"name": "Naan Bread", "measure": "to serve", "original": "to serve Naan Bread"}]
instructions: ["Heat the oil in a frying pan over high heat until it\u2019s shimmering hot. Add the paneer, then turn the heat down a little. Fry until it starts to brown at the edges, then turn it over and brown on each side \u2013 the paneer will brown faster than you think, so don\u2019t walk away. Remove the paneer from the pan and drain on kitchen paper.\r\nPut the ginger, cumin, turmeric, ground coriander and chilli in the pan, and fry everything for", "min. Add the tomatoes, mashing them with the back of a spoon and simmer everything for", "mins until the sauce smells fragrant. Add a splash of water if it\u2019s too thick. Season well. Add the peas and simmer for a further", "mins, then stir in the paneer and sprinkle over the garam masala. Divide between two bowls, top with coriander leaves and serve with naan bread, roti or rice."]

title: Nutty Chicken Curry
ingredients: [{"name": "Red Chilli", "measure": "1 large", "original": "1 large Red Chilli"}, {"name": "Ginger", "measure": "0.5", "original": "0.5 Ginger"}, {"name": "Garlic", "measure": "1 large", "original": "1 large Garlic"}, {"name": "Coriander", "measure": "Bunch", "original": "Bunch Coriander"}, {"name": "Sunflower Oil", "measure": "1 tbsp", "original": "1 tbsp Sunflower Oil"}, {"name": "Chicken Breasts", "measure": "4", "original": "4 Chicken Breasts"}, {"name": "Peanut Butter", "measure": "5 tblsp", "original": "5 tblsp Peanut Butter"}, {"name": "Chicken Stock", "measure": "150ml", "original": "150ml Chicken Stock"}, {"name": "Greek Yogurt", "measure": "200g", "original": "200g Greek Yogurt"}]
instructions: ["Finely slice a quarter of the chilli, then put the rest in a food processor with the ginger, garlic, coriander stalks and one-third of the leaves. Whizz to a rough paste with a splash of water if needed.\r\nHeat the oil in a frying pan, then quickly brown the chicken chunks for", "min. Stir in the paste for another min, then add the peanut butter, stock and yogurt. When the sauce is gently bubbling, cook for", "mins until the chicken is just cooked through and sauce thickened. Stir in most of the remaining coriander, then scatter the rest on top with the chilli, if using. Eat with rice or mashed sweet potato."]

title: Recheado Masala Fish
ingredients: [{"name": "Mackerel", "measure": "4", "original": "4 Mackerel"}, {"name": "Red Chilli", "measure": "18 dried", "original": "18 dried Red Chilli"}, {"name": "Ginger", "measure": "1 inch", "original": "1 inch Ginger"}, {"name": "Garlic", "measure": "8 cloves", "original": "8 cloves Garlic"}, {"name": "Pepper", "measure": "1.5 tsp", "original": "1.5 tsp Pepper"}, {"name": "Cumin", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Cumin"}, {"name": "Turmeric", "measure": "\u00bd tsp", "original": "\u00bd tsp Turmeric"}, {"name": "Cinnamon stick", "measure": "to taste", "original": "Cinnamon stick"}, {"name": "Cloves", "measure": "4", "original": "4 Cloves"}, {"name": "Cardamom", "measure": "2", "original": "2 Cardamom"}, {"name": "Sugar", "measure": "1 tbsp", "original": "1 tbsp Sugar"}, {"name": "Tamarind ball", "measure": "2 marble sized", "original": "2 marble sized Tamarind ball"}, {"name": "Vinegar", "measure": "2.5 tbsp", "original": "2.5 tbsp Vinegar"}, {"name": "Oil", "measure": "for frying", "original": "for frying Oil"}]
instructions: ["Soak all the spices, ginger, garlic, tamarind pulp and kashmiri chilies except oil in vinegar.", "Add sugar and salt.", "Also add turmeric powder.", "Combine all nicely and marinate for 35-40 mins.", "Grind the mixture until soft and smooth. Add more vinegar if required but ensure the paste has to be thick so add vinegar accordingly. If the masala paste is thin then it would not stick to the fish.", "Rinse the fish slit from the center and give some incision from the top. You could see the fish below for clarity.", "Now stuff the paste into the center and into the incision. Coat the entire fish with this paste. Marinate the fish for 30 mins.", "Place oil in a shallow pan, once oil is quite hot shallow fry the stuffed mackerels.", "Fry until golden brown from both sides", "Serve the recheado mackerels hot with salad, lime wedges, rice and curry.", "Ensure the masala paste is thick else the result won't be good.", "If you aren't able to find kashmiri chilies then use bedgi chilies or kashmiri red chili powder.", "You could use white vinegar or coconut vinegar.", "Any left over paste could be stored in the fridge for future use.", "Cinnamon could be avoided as it's a strong spice used generally for meat or chicken."]

title: Smoked Haddock Kedgeree
ingredients: [{"name": "Butter", "measure": "50g", "original": "50g Butter"}, {"name": "Onion", "measure": "1 chopped", "original": "1 chopped Onion"}, {"name": "Cardamom", "measure": "3 Pods", "original": "3 Pods Cardamom"}, {"name": "Turmeric", "measure": "1/4 tsp", "original": "1/4 tsp Turmeric"}, {"name": "Cinnamon Stick", "measure": "1 small", "original": "1 small Cinnamon Stick"}, {"name": "Bay Leaf", "measure": "Sprigs of fresh", "original": "Sprigs of fresh Bay Leaf"}, {"name": "Basmati Rice", "measure": "450g", "original": "450g Basmati Rice"}, {"name": "Chicken Stock", "measure": "1 Litre", "original": "1 Litre Chicken Stock"}, {"name": "Smoked Haddock", "measure": "750g", "original": "750g Smoked Haddock"}, {"name": "Eggs", "measure": "3", "original": "3 Eggs"}, {"name": "Parsley", "measure": "3 tblsp chopped", "original": "3 tblsp chopped Parsley"}, {"name": "Lemon", "measure": "1 chopped", "original": "1 chopped Lemon"}]
instructions:
["Melt 50g butter in a large saucepan (about 20cm across), add", "finely chopped medium onion and cook gently over a medium heat for", "minutes, until softened but not browned.

Stir in", "split cardamom pods, ¼ tsp turmeric,", "small cinnamon stick and", "bay leaves, then cook for", "minute.

Tip in 450g basmati rice and stir until it is all well coated in the spicy butter.

Pour in", "litre chicken or fish stock, add ½ teaspoon salt and bring to the boil, stir once to release any rice from the bottom of the pan. Cover with a close-fitting lid, reduce the heat to low and leave to cook very gently for", "minutes.

Meanwhile, bring some water to the boil in a large shallow pan. Add 750g un-dyed smoked haddock fillet and simmer for", "minutes, until the fish is just cooked. Lift it out onto a plate and leave until cool enough to handle.

Hard-boil", "eggs for", "minutes.

Flake the fish, discarding any skin and bones. Drain the eggs, cool slightly, then peel and chop. 

Uncover the rice and remove the bay leaves, cinnamon stick and cardamom pods if you wish to. Gently fork in the fish and the chopped eggs, cover again and return to the heat for", "minutes, or until the fish has heated through.

Gently stir in almost all the", "tbsp chopped fresh parsley, and season with a little salt and black pepper to taste. Serve scattered with the remaining parsley and garnished with", "lemon, cut into wedges."]

["Mix the cornflour and", "tbsp soy sauce, toss in the prawns and set aside for", "mins. Stir the vinegar, remaining soy sauce, tomato purée, sugar and", "tbsp water together to make a sauce.

ingredients: [{"name": "Tofu", "measure": "450g", "original": "450g Tofu"}, {"name": "Minced Beef", "measure": "100g", "original": "100g Minced Beef"}, {"name": "Sesame Seed Oil", "measure": "1/2 tbs", "original": "1/2 tbs Sesame Seed Oil"}, {"name": "Doubanjiang", "measure": "1 1/2 tsp", "original": "1 1/2 tsp Doubanjiang"}, {"name": "Fermented Black Beans", "measure": "1/2 tsp", "original": "1/2 tsp Fermented Black Beans"}, {"name": "Pepper", "measure": "1 tbs", "original": "1 tbs Pepper"}, {"name": "Salt", "measure": "1/2 tsp", "original": "1/2 tsp Salt"}, {"name": "Sichuan pepper", "measure": "1/2 tsp", "original": "1/2 tsp Sichuan pepper"}, {"name": "Soy Sauce", "measure": "1 tbs", "original": "1 tbs Soy Sauce"}, {"name": "Water", "measure": "400ml", "original": "400ml Water"}, {"name": "Olive Oil", "measure": "2 tbs", "original": "2 tbs Olive Oil"}, {"name": "Scallions", "measure": "2 chopped", "original": "2 chopped Scallions"}, {"name": "Spring Onions", "measure": "4", "original": "4 Spring Onions"}, {"name": "Garlic", "measure": "2 cloves chopped", "original": "2 cloves chopped Garlic"}, {"name": "Ginger", "measure": "4 sliced", "original": "4 sliced Ginger"}, {"name": "Water", "measure": "2 1/2 tbs", "original": "2 1/2 tbs Water"}, {"name": "Cornstarch", "measure": "1 tbs", "original": "1 tbs Cornstarch"}]

["Add a small pinch of salt and sesame oil to minced beef. Mix well and set aside.
Mix", "tablespoon of cornstarch with", "and ½ tablespoons of water in a small bowl to make water starch.
Cut tofu into square cubes (around 2cms). Bring a large amount of water to a boil and then add a pinch of salt. Slide the tofu in and cook for", "minute. Move out and drain.
Get a wok and heat up around", "tablespoons of oil, fry the minced meat until crispy. Transfer out beef out and leave the oil in.
Fry doubanjiang for", "minute over slow fire and then add garlic, scallion white, ginger and fermented black beans to cook for", "seconds until aroma. Then mix pepper flakes in.
Add water to the seasonings and bring to boil over high fire. Gently slide the tofu cubes. Add light soy sauce and beef.Slow the heat after boiling and then simmer for", "minutes. Then add chopped garlic greens.
Stir the water starch and then pour half of the mixture to the simmering pot. Wait for around", "seconds and then pour the other half. You can slightly taste the tofu and add pinch of salt if not salty enough. By the way, if you feel it is too spicy, add some sugar can milder the taste. But be carefully as the broth is very hot at this point.
Transfer out when almost all the seasonings stick to tofu cubes. Sprinkle Szechuan peppercorn powder (to taste)and chopped garlic greens if using.
Serve immediately with steamed rice."]

instructions: ["Rinsing and soaking your rice is key to achieving the perfect texture. Measure the rice into a bowl, cover with cold water, then use your fingers to massage the grains of rice \u2013 the water will become cloudy. Drain and rinse again with fresh water. Repeat five more times until the water stays clear.\r\n\r\nSTEP", "Tip the rinsed rice into a saucepan with 400ml water, or 200ml dashi and 200ml water, bring to the boil, then turn down the heat to a low simmer, cover with a tight-fitting lid with a steam hole and cook for", "mins. instructions:
["Prep:15min  ›  Cook:30min  ›  Ready in:45min 

For the curry sauce: Heat oil in medium non-stick saucepan, add onion and garlic and cook until softened. Stir in carrots and cook over low heat for", "minutes.
Add flour and curry powder; cook for", "minute. Gradually stir in stock until combined; add honey, soy sauce and bay leaf. Slowly bring to the boil.
Turn down heat and simmer for", "minutes or until sauce thickens but is still of pouring consistency. Stir in garam masala. Pour the curry sauce through a sieve; return to saucepan and keep on low heat until ready to serve.
For the chicken: Season both sides of chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Place flour, egg and breadcrumbs in separate bowls and arrange in a row. Coat the chicken breasts in flour, then dip them into the egg, then coat in breadcrumbs, making sure you cover both sides.
Heat oil in large frying pan over medium-high heat. Place chicken into hot oil and cook until golden brown, about", "minutes each side. Once cooked, place on kitchen paper to absorb excess oil.

title: Sushi
ingredients: [{"name": "Sushi Rice", "measure": "300ml", "original": "300ml Sushi Rice"}, {"name": "Rice wine", "measure": "100ml", "original": "100ml Rice wine"}, {"name": "Caster Sugar", "measure": "2 tbs", "original": "2 tbs Caster Sugar"}, {"name": "Mayonnaise", "measure": "3 tbs", "original": "3 tbs Mayonnaise"}, {"name": "Rice wine", "measure": "1 tbs", "original": "1 tbs Rice wine"}, {"name": "Soy Sauce", "measure": "1 tbs", "original": "1 tbs Soy Sauce"}, {"name": "Cucumber", "measure": "1", "original": "1 Cucumber"}]
instructions: ["STEP 1", "TO MAKE SUSHI ROLLS: Pat out some rice. Lay a nori sheet on the mat, shiny-side down. Dip your hands in the vinegared water, then pat handfuls of rice on top in a 1cm thick layer, leaving the furthest edge from you clear.", "STEP 2", "Spread over some Japanese mayonnaise. Use a spoon to spread out a thin layer of mayonnaise down the middle of the rice.", "STEP 3", "Add the filling. Get your child to top the mayonnaise with a line of their favourite fillings \u2013 here we\u2019ve used tuna and cucumber.", "STEP 4", "Roll it up. Lift the edge of the mat over the rice, applying a little pressure to keep everything in a tight roll.", "STEP 5", "Stick down the sides like a stamp. When you get to the edge without any rice, brush with a little water and continue to roll into a tight roll.", "STEP 6", "Wrap in cling film. Remove the mat and roll tightly in cling film before a grown-up cuts the sushi into thick slices, then unravel the cling film.", "STEP 7", "TO MAKE PRESSED SUSHI: Layer over some smoked salmon. Line a loaf tin with cling film, then place a thin layer of smoked salmon inside on top of the cling film.", "STEP 8", "Cover with rice and press down. Press about 3cm of rice over the fish, fold the cling film over and press down as much as you can, using another tin if you have one.", "STEP 9", "Tip it out like a sandcastle. Turn block of sushi onto a chopping board. Get a grown-up to cut into fingers, then remove the cling film.", "STEP 10", "TO MAKE SUSHI BALLS: Choose your topping. Get a small square of cling film and place a topping, like half a prawn or a small piece of smoked salmon, on it. Use damp hands to roll walnut-sized balls of rice and place on the topping.", "STEP 11", "Make into tight balls. Bring the corners of the cling film together and tighten into balls by twisting it up, then unwrap and serve."]

title: Teriyaki Chicken Casserole
ingredients: [{"name": "soy sauce", "measure": "3/4 cup", "original": "3/4 cup soy sauce"}, {"name": "water", "measure": "1/2 cup", "original": "1/2 cup water"}, {"name": "brown sugar", "measure": "1/4 cup", "original": "1/4 cup brown sugar"}, {"name": "ground ginger", "measure": "1/2 teaspoon", "original": "1/2 teaspoon ground ginger"}, {"name": "minced garlic", "measure": "1/2 teaspoon", "original": "1/2 teaspoon minced garlic"}, {"name": "cornstarch", "measure": "4 Tablespoons", "original": "4 Tablespoons cornstarch"}, {"name": "chicken breasts", "measure": "2", "original": "2 chicken breasts"}, {"name": "stir-fry vegetables", "measure": "1 (12 oz.)", "original": "1 (12 oz.) stir-fry vegetables"}, {"name": "brown rice", "measure": "3 cups", "original": "3 cups brown rice"}]
instructions:
["Preheat oven to 350° F. Spray a 9x", "inch baking pan with non-stick spray.
Combine soy sauce, ½ cup water, brown sugar, ginger and garlic in a small saucepan and cover. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove lid and cook for one minute once boiling.
Meanwhile, stir together the corn starch and", "tablespoons of water in a separate dish until smooth. Once sauce is boiling, add mixture to the saucepan and stir to combine. Cook until the sauce starts to thicken then remove from heat.
Place the chicken breasts in the prepared pan. Pour one cup of the sauce over top of chicken. Place chicken in oven and bake", "minutes or until cooked through. Remove from oven and shred chicken in the dish using two forks.
*Meanwhile, steam or cook the vegetables according to package directions.
Add the cooked vegetables and rice to the casserole dish with the chicken. Add most of the remaining sauce, reserving a bit to drizzle over the top when serving. Gently toss everything together in the casserole dish until combined. Return to oven and cook", "minutes. Remove from oven and let stand", "minutes before serving. title: Tonkatsu pork
ingredients: [{"name": "Pork Chops", "measure": "4", "original": "4 Pork Chops"}, {"name": "Flour", "measure": "100g", "original": "100g Flour"}, {"name": "Eggs", "measure": "2 Beaten", "original": "2 Beaten Eggs"}, {"name": "Breadcrumbs", "measure": "100g", "original": "100g Breadcrumbs"}, {"name": "Vegetable Oil", "measure": "Fry", "original": "Fry Vegetable Oil"}, {"name": "Tomato Ketchup", "measure": "2 tbs", "original": "2 tbs Tomato Ketchup"}, {"name": "Worcestershire Sauce", "measure": "2 tbs", "original": "2 tbs Worcestershire Sauce"}, {"name": "Oyster Sauce", "measure": "1 tbs", "original": "1 tbs Oyster Sauce"}, {"name": "Caster Sugar", "measure": "2 tblsp", "original": "2 tblsp Caster Sugar"}]
instructions:
["Remove the large piece of fat on the edge of each pork loin, then bash each of the loins between two pieces of baking parchment until around 1cm in thickness – you can do this using a meat tenderiser or a rolling pin. Once bashed, use your hands to reshape the meat to its original shape and thickness – this step will ensure the meat is as succulent as possible.

STEP", "Put the flour, eggs and panko breadcrumbs into three separate wide-rimmed bowls. Season the meat, then dip first in the flour, followed by the eggs, then the breadcrumbs.

STEP", "In a large frying or sauté pan, add enough oil to come 2cm up the side of the pan. Heat the oil to 180C – if you don’t have a thermometer, drop a bit of panko into the oil and if it sinks a little then starts to fry, the oil is ready. Add two pork chops and cook for", "secs on each side, then remove and leave to rest on a wire rack for", "mins. Repeat with the remaining pork chops.

STEP", "While the pork is resting, make the sauce by whisking the ingredients together, adding a splash of water if it’s particularly thick. Slice the tonkatsu and serve drizzled with the sauce."]

title: Thai Green Curry
ingredients: [{"name": "Potatoes", "measure": "225g new", "original": "225g new Potatoes"}, {"name": "green beans", "measure": "100g", "original": "100g green beans"}, {"name": "sunflower oil", "measure": "1 tbsp", "original": "1 tbsp sunflower oil"}, {"name": "garlic", "measure": "1 clove", "original": "1 clove garlic"}, {"name": "Thai green curry paste", "measure": "4 tsp", "original": "4 tsp Thai green curry paste"}, {"name": "coconut milk", "measure": "400ml", "original": "400ml coconut milk"}, {"name": "Thai fish sauce", "measure": "2 tsp", "original": "2 tsp Thai fish sauce"}, {"name": "Sugar", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Sugar"}, {"name": "Chicken", "measure": "450g boneless", "original": "450g boneless Chicken"}, {"name": "lime", "measure": "2 fresh kaffir leaves", "original": "2 fresh kaffir leaves lime"}, {"name": "basil", "measure": "handfull", "original": "handfull basil"}, {"name": "Rice", "measure": "Boiled", "original": "Boiled Rice"}]
instructions:
["Put the potatoes in a pan of boiling water and cook for", "minutes. Throw in the beans and cook for a further", "minutes, by which time both should be just tender but not too soft. Drain and put to one side.
In a wok or large frying pan, heat the oil until very hot, then drop in the garlic and cook until golden, this should take only a few seconds. Don’t let it go very dark or it will spoil the taste. Spoon in the curry paste and stir it around for a few seconds to begin to cook the spices and release all the flavours. Next, pour in the coconut milk and let it come to a bubble.
Stir in the fish sauce and sugar, then the pieces of chicken. Turn the heat down to a simmer and cook, covered, for about", "minutes until the chicken is cooked.
Tip in the potatoes and beans and let them warm through in the hot coconut milk, then add a lovely citrussy flavour by stirring in the shredded lime leaves (or lime zest). The basil leaves go in next, but only leave them briefly on the heat or they will quickly lose their brightness. Scatter with the lime garnish and serve immediately with boiled rice."]

instructions: ["Mise en place (put things in place).", "Combine the flour, yeast, sugar, and water in a large bowl with a wooden spoon.", "Add more flour if it sticks to the sides and resembles more like a batter than dough.All-Purpose Flour will give you more of a chewier crust, while Bread Flour will be crispier.Once it comes together and isn't as sticky, scrape it out onto a well floured surface and sprinkle the salt on top.Kneed the salt into the dough, adding flour as necessary.Knead for 10 minutes, check if the dough is ready by slightly indenting the top of the dough, if it springs back you're good.Tuck the ends underneath to stretch out the top and make a large ball, then put it in a well greased bowl rubbed with olive oil to proof.Wrap it with cling film.", "Place your cling wrap wrapped bowl inside the Microwave, and let it proof for an hour or until it has doubled in size.Don't turn the microwave on, just let it sit in there.While your dough is proofing you can prepare the pesto.Soak almonds in water for fifteen minutes.Wash and dry basil leaves.Grate cheese. (extra for pizza too)In a food processor we're going to put our basil, the cheese, soaked almonds, little salt and pepper, and 1/4 cup of extra virgin olive oil.Process it on and off for thirty seconds.Then drizzle in the rest of the olive oil while the food processor is on. This makes sure you get the optimal consistency for your likings.When it's made fresh the oil tends to separate from the other ingredients. I suggest serving this after it's been in the refrigerator for an hour because the pesto rests and stays together better.When the dough has doubled plop it onto a lightly dusted countertop and move it around so the entire dough gets covered.Divide it into thirds.Preheat the oven to 500F and place a baking stone on the middle rack. (you can also use an overturned cookie sheet)NOTE: The baking stone/cookie sheet has to be larger than the size of the pizza you are making, otherwise it will hang over the edges and burn onto the oven rack.Coat one ball of dough with flour and place it on a well-floured surface. Using your fingertips, gently flatten the dough into an 8-inch disk, leaving an inch or so of outer edge thicker than the center.Using your hands, gently stretch it into a 10-12 inch round, working along the edges and giving the dough quarter turns as you stretch it.", "Transfer the dough onto a pizza peel coated with flour or semolina, cornmeal is fine as well.Top with a thin layer of the pesto.Mandolin thin slices of potato and arrange them on the pizza. I don't prepare the potato ahead of time because sometimes it will oxidize and turn red and it makes for an ugly pizza.Slide the pizza onto the stone and bake it for 10-12 minutes or until the crust is brown and the cheese as melty and shimmering.Wait a little to slice and serve.", "Serve it hot.I feel obliged to remind you about the other two balls of dough, but once you devour the first one I guarantee you'll be searching for the others. And as always,Chow!"]
